subject: Data
title: Minard's Napoleon Map: The Best Chart Ever Made
description: A micro-lesson that makes Minard's Napoleon Map: The Best Chart Ever Made usable.

hook.text: In 1869, a French engineer drew a chart that Edward Tufte called 'the best statistical graphic ever.'

buildup.text: Charles Minard mapped Napoleon's 1812 Russian campaign â€” showing army size, direction, and temperature.

discovery.text: A thick band of 422,000 soldiers marches to Moscow. A hairline thread of 10,000 returns.

twist.text: The chart encodes six variables on a single 2D image â€” geography, army size, direction, dates, and temperature.

climax.text: Minard told a devastating story of military disaster without using a single word of narrative.

punchline.text: One chart told the story of 400,000 deaths.

quiz.question: How many data variables does Minard's Napoleon chart encode?
